results.title: Fish and their characteristics
results.brief_description: Underwater photography introduces the characteristics of fish and shows how this group of vertebrates is fitted for its environment. Illustrates the variety of form, protective devices and reproductive methods in different types of fish. Distinguishes true fish from other marine animals and studies the freshwater perch as a representative fish.

results.title: Fish and chips cooking library. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Simple recipes garnished with humour and a smattering of hints and tips are demonstrated by Peter Doyle of the Sydney restaurant family. He shows you everything you need to know about how to make delicious seafood meals, including how to cook a fish in your dishwasher. The video is accompanied by a recipe booklet which also includes charts which show you which fish to substitute for another, and when particular fish are in season. The video is also time coded so that you can find the recipe you want, quickly and easily.

results.title: Fish
results.brief_description: The purchase of several goldfish signals the beginning of a learning adventure in the classroom for a group of students. Introduces the anatomy of the fish and its means of locomotion. Demonstrates experiments that are designed to discover whether goldfish can discriminate between colors.

results.title: First year A.D.
results.creator_credit: Franciscan Communication Center and Karl Holtsnider
results.brief_description: An asthmatic child is hospitalized, bringing together his estranged parents, whose obvious hostility toward each other intrudes upon their real concern for their child. They finally lose control and quarrel in his presence as he is about to leave the hospital. The boy has another serious attack, but with the help of a sympathetic nurse, the parents realise they must stop battling for their child’s love.

results.title: First winter
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Smith, Sam Grana and Roman Kroitor
results.brief_description: This historical drama features the first winter spent in Canada by a family of Irish immigrants deep in the Ottawa Valley. The year is 1830. Because the father is working in a logging camp, the mother has sole charge of the family. Sickness overtakes her and she dies. The children are left on their own to survive. The film graphically illustrates the enormous hardships endured by the first settlers who had to cope with a climate they were unfamiliar with. Filmed in Algonquin Park.

results.title: First Tuesday: four hours in My Lai [anatomy of a massacre]
results.creator_credit: Yorkshire Television, Kevin Sim and Michael Bilton
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the massacre of villagers (mostly women and children), by U.S. troops at the Vietnamese village of My Lai on March 16, 1968. Survivors, both villagers and soldiers, speak of their experiences, memories and how they have coped since.

results.title: First Touch
results.brief_description: Using archival films of the Apollo lunar missions in the late 1960s and early 70s, this 2 screen video installation contemplates humankind’s first touch of the moon. Often considered a giant leap in human development, the video concentrates on the delicate and hesitant movements of the astronauts and their spaceships as they overcome the limits of outer space. With both humour and melancholy, stunning images of the moon, the earth, and the astronauts and their spacecraft, are interwoven into a wondrous contemplation of this extraordinary achievement.
